entry.title: Easy to use and nice options
entry.content: I like working with Fotor. I can't compare it to any other apps that are used for editing photos so I am not sure this app will offer what other people are looking for but I like it very much, for me it is good, stable, has enough possibilities and works very well.

Easy to use and nice options

I like working with Fotor. I can't compare it to any other apps that are used for editing photos so I am not sure this app will offer what other people are looking for but I like it very much, for me it is good, stable, has enough possibilities and works very well.

entry.title: Niet meer opslaan
entry.content: In deze update is het niet meer mogelijk om je collage op te slaan in de fotorol. Zonde want dat gebruik je het meest!!! Nu kan je alleen nog sharen via social media. Moet je de foto daar weer uit knippen en opslaan. Omslachtig en onhandig. Dan zijn er betere apps te krijgen.

Niet meer opslaan

In deze update is het niet meer mogelijk om je collage op te slaan in de fotorol. Zonde want dat gebruik je het meest!!! Nu kan je alleen nog sharen via social media. Moet je de foto daar weer uit knippen en opslaan. Omslachtig en onhandig. Dan zijn er betere apps te krijgen.

entry.title: Does what it promises through an intuitive UI.
entry.content:
Nice and clean UI. Which is easy to get the hang of. You see in one glance how, what you want to do, needs to be done.
Right after my download combined 9 photos (open and select 9 photos from my film roll) into one of the preset 9-photo collage layouts. Added a **subtle** drop shadow under the photos with the slider, and saved. Then used the collage for my pin on Pinterest. Less than two minutes work.
P.S. There are also magazine style layout presets.
EEEEEEExcelEEEEEnt!!!!

Does what it promises through an intuitive UI.

Nice and clean UI. Which is easy to get the hang of. You see in one glance how, what you want to do, needs to be done.

Right after my download combined 9 photos (open and select 9 photos from my film roll) into one of the preset 9-photo collage layouts. Added a **subtle** drop shadow under the photos with the slider, and saved. Then used the collage for my pin on Pinterest. Less than two minutes work.

P.S. There are also magazine style layout presets.

EEEEEEExcelEEEEEnt!!!!
